p: The proton decoupled 13C-NMR spectrum with the aid of DEPT-135 revealed the presence of seven quaternary, five methine, three methylene, and five methyl groups. The spectrum (Table 2) revealed the presence of two carbonyl carbons at δ C 210.5 (C-3′) and 203.5 (C-2″). The three methylene groups are apparent at δ 40.3 (C-2′), 22.0 (C-1′) and 29.7 (C-1″). The sp2 quaternary carbons at δ 140.5, 138.3, 137.9 and 121.1 were attributed to C-2, C-8a, C-6 and C-8, respectively. The other oxygenated sp3 quaternary carbon appeared at δ 81.9 (C-3″). Two methine carbons are also evident at δ 27.3 (C-4′) and 55.7 (C-3). The data generated led us to the identification of compound 4 as shown in Fig. 1.
